availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry B. Stanwood (Kentucky QM sgt, 1st sgt, 2nd lieut 4th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Kentucky soldier. Massachusetts native. Married to Martha Crow Stanwood. Father of Charles Stanwood. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as quartermaster sergeant, first sergeant, and second lieutenant from July 16, 1861, to August 17, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 158A.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 190.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #464.126, Certificate #388,975.
Kentucky Advocate (Danville, Ky), January 9, 1874, p. 3.
